etymology.description: Ideogram (指事): a bent object; also simplified from 麴 via the variant 麯/曲.
etymology.interpretation: Graphically represents something bent or curved, matching senses like bent, winding, and crooked, and extending metaphorically to curving lines and shapes. The same graph was later reused as the simplified form of 麴 (qū, malt/yeast) through the variant 麯/曲, which is etymologically separate from its core ‘bent’ sense.

examples.chinese: 这条河道很曲折(這條河道很曲折)。
examples.english: This river channel is very winding.

examples.chinese: 他弹了一首优美的曲子(他彈了一首優美的曲子)。
examples.pinyin: Tā tán le yì shǒu yōuměi de qǔzi.
